name: GPT-3
description: The original large language model that started the AI revolution. 175B parameters. Replaced by GPT-3.5 and GPT-4.

name: GPT-3.5 Turbo (0301)
description: The first ChatGPT-era model exposed via API. Fast, cheap, and surprisingly capable. Replaced by newer snapshots.

name: Codex
description: AI code generation model that powered GitHub Copilot v1. Fine-tuned GPT-3 on code. Killed when GPT-4 could code better.

name: DALL·E 2
description: Revolutionary AI image generator. Made "AI art" mainstream. Outpaced by DALL·E 3, Midjourney, and Stable Diffusion.

name: Google Bard
description: Google's first chatbot response to ChatGPT. Launched with a factual error in its demo. Rebranded to Gemini after less than a year.

name: PaLM 2
description: Google's flagship LLM that powered Bard. 340B parameters. Replaced by Gemini models after less than a year.

name: PaLM API
description: Google's first public LLM API. Barely lasted 18 months before being replaced by the Gemini API.

name: LaMDA
description: Google's conversational AI model. Famous for the engineer who claimed it was sentient. Replaced by PaLM 2.

name: Bing Chat
description: Microsoft's ChatGPT-powered Bing search. Famously threatened users and declared love for a NYT reporter. Rebranded to Copilot.

name: GitHub Copilot X
description: Ambitious vision for AI-powered development with voice, chat, PRs, and docs. Most features quietly shelved or absorbed into Copilot Chat.
cause: Quietly shelved — features absorbed into Copilot

name: Jasper AI (Original)
description: AI marketing copywriter that raised $125M at $1.5B valuation. ChatGPT made their GPT-3 wrapper business model obsolete. Pivoted to enterprise.

name: Character.AI (Independent)
description: AI chatbot platform by ex-Google researchers. 20M+ users. Founders acqui-hired back to Google, company left as a shell.

name: Stability AI (Stable Diffusion)
description: Open-source AI image generation pioneer. CEO resigned amid financial troubles, lawsuits, and mass departures. Company restructured.

name: GPT-4 (Original)
description: The model that changed everything. First model to pass the bar exam. Original version deprecated in favor of GPT-4 Turbo and GPT-4o.

name: GPT-4 Turbo Preview
description: 128K context window preview. The 'turbo' that was always in preview. Never left preview before being replaced by GPT-4o.

name: Claude 1.0
description: Anthropic's first commercial model. Constitutional AI approach. Quickly overshadowed by Claude 2 and Claude 3.

name: Claude 2
description: 200K context window was groundbreaking at launch. Lifespan: 8 months. Replaced by the Claude 3 family.

name: Claude 3 Opus
description: Anthropic's flagship model that topped benchmarks. Extremely expensive ($75/M output tokens). Made obsolete by Claude 3.5 Sonnet being better AND cheaper.
cause: Effectively deprecated — 3.5 Sonnet is better and cheaper

name: Gemini 1.0 Ultra
description: Google's answer to GPT-4. Launched 11 months after GPT-4. Replaced by Gemini 1.5 Pro and 2.0 within a year.

name: Inflection Pi (Original)
description: "A personal AI for everyone." Raised $1.3B. Entire founding team acqui-hired by Microsoft. Pi now runs on someone else's models.

name: Cohere Generate (Original)
description: Cohere's original text generation API. Replaced by Command R and Command R+ models. Enterprise pivot.

name: Hugging Chat (v1)
description: Open-source ChatGPT alternative. Original version ran OpenAssistant. Rebuilt multiple times with different models.

name: Galactica
description: Meta's scientific AI model. Lived for 3 DAYS. Demo taken down after it confidently generated fake scientific papers. Speed-run to the graveyard.

name: BlenderBot 3
description: Meta's open chatbot. Immediately started saying controversial things about Mark Zuckerberg. Quietly discontinued.
cause: Quietly killed — replaced by Llama efforts

name: LLaMA 1
description: Meta's first open-weight LLM. Leaked one week after release. Kickstarted the entire open-source AI movement. Replaced by Llama 2.

name: Llama 2
description: First truly open commercial LLM. 70B params. Dominated open-source for 9 months until Llama 3 buried it.

name: Mistral 7B (v0.1)
description: French AI startup's first model. Punched way above its weight class. Superseded by v0.2, v0.3, and Mistral Small.

name: Mixtral 8x7B
description: Pioneering Mixture-of-Experts model. Torch-dropped via torrent link. Made MoE architecture cool again. Replaced by Mixtral 8x22B.

name: text-davinci-003
description: The last of the InstructGPT line. Many developers' first LLM API experience. End of an era when GPT-3.5 Turbo was cheaper and better.

name: Whisper API (v1)
description: OpenAI's speech-to-text API based on Whisper. Original version replaced by whisper-large-v3 and newer turbo variants.

name: ChatGPT Plugins
description: Remember when OpenAI was going to be the "app store for AI"? Plugins were launched with huge fanfare, used by nobody, and quietly replaced by GPTs.

name: Custom GPTs (Store)
description: OpenAI's GPT Store was supposed to be the "App Store moment" for AI. Revenue sharing never materialized. Most GPTs are abandoned. Store effectively dead.
cause: Abandoned — store is a ghost town

name: Azure OpenAI GPT-3
description: Microsoft's enterprise gateway to GPT-3. The original enterprise AI API. Shut down when GPT-3 models were fully deprecated.

name: AlphaCode
description: AI coding system that competed at human level in programming competitions. Never publicly released. Replaced by AlphaCode 2/Gemini.

name: Sparrow
description: DeepMind's RLHF chatbot. Published as a research paper. Never publicly launched. Absorbed into Gemini development.

name: Chinchilla
description: The model that proved bigger isn't always better — training data matters more. Its "scaling laws" paper changed the industry. Model itself was never released.

name: Amazon CodeWhisperer
description: Amazon's GitHub Copilot competitor. Rebranded to Amazon Q Developer after 2 years. Nobody noticed.

name: Alexa LLM
description: Amazon announced a "new, more intelligent" LLM-powered Alexa. It was never actually shipped. The team was reportedly in chaos.

name: Siri AI (Pre-Apple Intelligence)
description: The original AI assistant. Fell so far behind ChatGPT that Apple had to rebuild it from scratch as "Apple Intelligence." RIP the old Siri.
cause: Major rebuild — replaced by Apple Intelligence

name: Replika (Romantic ERP Mode)
description: AI companion chatbot's romantic/adult features. Millions of users had their AI "partners" lobotomized overnight. The saddest entry here.

name: Ernie Bot (Public)
description: Baidu's ChatGPT competitor for China. Initial demo was pre-recorded. Now mostly overshadowed by DeepSeek and Qwen in the Chinese market.

name: Falcon 180B
description: The UAE's massive open model. Briefly topped Hugging Face leaderboards. Awkward license killed adoption. Forgotten within months.
cause: Abandoned — license issues, community moved on

name: Yi-34B
description: Kai-Fu Lee's open model that topped benchmarks. License controversy over Llama code. Replaced by Yi-1.5 series.

name: GPT-4V (Vision Preview)
description: GPT-4 with eyes. The preview that showed the world multimodal AI. Absorbed into GPT-4o which can see, hear, and speak.

name: Phind Model v1
description: AI code search engine's custom model. Briefly competitive with GPT-4 for coding. Company pivoted to using other models.

name: WizardLM
description: Microsoft Research's open model series. Models mysteriously pulled from Hugging Face overnight. Team reportedly reassigned. Repos later restored but development stopped.

name: OpenAI Embeddings v1 (ada-001)
description: The first widely-used text embedding model. Powered a million RAG demos. Replaced by text-embedding-3-small/large.

name: Stable Diffusion 1.5
description: The open-source image model that democratized AI art. Despite being outdated, it refused to die — community kept it alive long after SDXL launched.
cause: Effectively deprecated — SDXL and SD3 released

name: Midjourney (Discord-Only)
description: The AI art tool that lived entirely on Discord. Made stunning images through slash commands. Web app finally launched, ending the Discord-only era.
cause: Evolved — web platform replaced Discord bot

name: OpenAssistant
description: Community-driven open ChatGPT alternative. Huge volunteer effort. Data quality issues. Project fizzled as better alternatives emerged.

name: Vicuna-13B
description: UC Berkeley's fine-tuned LLaMA that was '90% of ChatGPT quality.' One of the first great open-source chat models. Made LMSYS famous.
cause: Superseded — newer open models are far better
